name: quirk
structure: Produces entries for different types of genres and worlds. The 'common' and 'rare' tables are generic and should be compatible with almost any world. To retain compatibility with most settings, the  non-generic tables should be called only from other tables by specifying their name directly.
note: Developed from the quirk generation section of 'Goblin Names' generator by Ron Calbick.
authors: Ron Calbick (as extracted from his goblin-names.json generator), ELF Vesala.

tables.name: init
tables.explanation: Initializing the required global variables, if any.

tables.name: bestial
entries: has very large feet with long clawed toes that are often used in battle

tables.name: animalistic
entries: likes to eat just about anything, including dirt, leaves, wood, paper, and just about anything else that is even remotely edible
often marks territory as an animal would, urinating at various key locations, even indoors
has a tendency to bury things, from sticks and rocks to valuables, and rarely remembers where they were buried afterwards

tables.name: retarded
entries: breaks into an absurd dance after any accomplishment, whether the task was important or not
jumps up and down wildly at anything humorous and has a laugh that sounds very much like a braying donkey

tables.name: primitive
entries: has a great number of body piercings of decoratively carved pieces of bone
is usually coated with a thick, dried layer of mud

tables.name: superstitious
entries: always throws a handful of small bones and reads them before making any important decisions
believes the moon grants special powers and loves sharing that notion with others

tables.name: knowledge
entries: has an unusual knowledge of uses for nearly any plant but tends to eat any of them that aren't harmful

tables.name: physical
entries: is rarely seen not eating, or at least in possession of, various foodstuffs
has eyes of two different colors and when speaking to others moves up close and opens them wide so they are easily noticed

tables.name: senses
entries: has an unusually large nose that is particularly keen, often used for tracking by scent
is missing an ear, claiming it simply fell off and was never found
has an unusually large nose that is particularly keen

tables.name: appearance
entries: has few teeth and even those remaining are in a state of severe decay, but nonetheless frequently smiles proudly
appears to have once been severely burned on nearly every body part but still manages to function almost normally
is completely hairless and has blotchy skin of various shades and tints

tables.name: movement
entries: is very bow-legged and moves about in a very awkward fashion as if actually mounted
can't stand still and is constantly bouncing from one foot to the other, pacing, or fidgeting

tables.name: hygiene
entries: smells especially noxious, often leaving a lingering odor behind

tables.name: behavior
entries: is always trying to sneak and hide from others, as if life were one big game of hide and seek

tables.name: manners
entries: is prone to frequent loud, odorous belching that often makes others sick to their stomachs
is prone to nose-picking when deep in thought or anxious about something
drools incessantly and has a tendency to spit on others when speaking

tables.name: speech
entries: has a penchant for dragons, but can't pronounce the word properly, calling them 'dagorns' instead
is incapable of speaking softly and often blurts things out at the most inopportune times

tables.name: clothing
entries: wears a trophy necklace of small rodent tails that looks ridiculous and smells horribly
wears clothing adorned with all manner of worthless knick-knacks, such as pieces of rotting rope, a cracked marble, or strips of colorful cloth
is unusually clean and takes great pride in wearing various ridiculous outfits
wears an absurd headdress that usually looks like its about to slip off and fall to the ground

tables.name: possession
entries: drags a very old, tattered, and barely recognizable scrap of blanket around everywhere
carries around a broken sword and longs to recover the other piece, after which it will be reforged and grant great power to its owner
is accompanied by a mongrel dog that looks fierce, growling and barking, but flees at the first sign of combat

tables.name: myth
tables.explanation: Quirks once rumoured to have existed.

tables.name: fantasy
tables.explanation: Quirks for fantasy worlds (with no basis in myth).

tables.name: test
tables.explanation: Test routine for checking the generator functionality.
